intro: Guettarda platycarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental value. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
